title: Macron replaces controversial education minister in reshuffle
summary: Amélie Oudéa-Castéra was minister of education, sports and the Olympics for less than a month. She returns to her old position – minister of sports and the Olympics – while Nicole Belloubet becomes education minister.

title: Three actresses accuse director Jacques Doillon of rape, sexual assault and harassment
summary: Judith Godrèche, Anna Mouglalis and Isild le Besco told Le Monde about the behavior of the author of 'The 15 Year Old.' Doillon's lawyer says he will reserve his explanations for the courts.

title: Zelensky ousts Ukrainian army reformer Valery Zaluzhny
summary: The 50-year-old general radically restructured his country's armed forces and cultivated a favorable reputation beyond military circles. On the front line since the Russian invasion, he was replaced on Thursday by ground forces commander Oleksandr Syrsky.

title: Biden cleared of charges in documents probe, mental capacity questioned
summary: The special counsel's report criticized Biden's mishandling of classified materials but ruled out charges. It also described the US president as an 'elderly man with a poor memory.'

title: Senegal's election postponement: 'This goes to the heart of our democratic model'
summary: El Hadji Omar Diop is a lecturer and researcher in public law at the Université Cheikh-Anta-Diop (UCAD) in Dakar. He explained the 'artificially created' institutional crisis.

title: Poland's government is trying to abolish homework
summary: An election promise made by the new majority has provoked an outcry from teachers and education experts, who were not consulted and worry that it will widen disparities among students.

title: Trump's fate lies in the hands of the Supreme Court, a key player in the presidential election
summary: The highest court in the United States is set to rule on both the total immunity claimed by the former president during his term of office and his participation in the Republican primaries in Colorado and Maine.

title: Prosecutors demand trial for director Christophe Ruggia over alleged abuse of Adèle Haenel
summary: French film director Christophe Ruggia has been charged with sexually assaulting actress Adèle Haenel when she was a minor.

title: Paris 2024: Each Olympic and Paralympic medal will have a piece of the Eiffel Tower
summary: The design of the 5,000 awards was revealed on Thursday. The jeweller Chaumet incorporated fragments of iron plates from the Eiffel Tower.

title: Huawei searched by French prosecutors on suspicion of improper conduct
summary: The raids were carried out as part of a preliminary investigation launched by France's financial prosecution service (PNF).

title: Israel-Hamas war: The long wait for displaced persons in southern Lebanon
summary: More than 86,000 local residents have fled their homes due to border clashes between Hezbollah and the Israeli army. The neediest are housed in collective shelters in precarious conditions.

title: ECHR faults France for police 'kettling' tactic
summary: The method involves large cordons of police officers containing a crowd in a limited area. The European Court of Human Rights found France guilty of using the tactic during a 2010 demonstration.

title: Last anti-Putin candidate Nadezhdin barred from Russian election
summary: Russia's election commission on Thursday refused to allow Boris Nadezhdin to run for the upcoming presidential election.

title: France recorded over 5,000 deaths due to summer 2023 heat
summary: Around 3,700 of the deaths were people aged over 75. Extreme heat has been straining healthcare systems, hitting older people, infants and children.

title: Icelandic volcano erupts for third time since December
summary: Lava spewed on the Reykjanes Peninsula, near the town of Grindavik which was evacuated because of the earlier eruption.

title: Biden mistakes dead leader for living one, again
summary: The president of the United States said he spoke with Helmut Kohl in June 2021. The former German chancellor passed away in 2017.

title: Netanyahu rejects Gaza ceasefire and hostage deal, calls Hamas's demands 'delusional'
summary: Refusing to give in to Hamas's 'delusional' demands, the Israeli prime minister threatened to extend ground operations to the Egyptian border.

title: Fukushima operator reports leak, says no contamination detected
summary: Highly radioactive water leaked from a treatment machine at the tsunami-hit Fukushima nuclear power plant, but no one was injured and radiation monitoring shows no impact to the outside environment, the utility operator said Thursday.

title: El Salvador unveils ultra-modern national library gifted by China
summary: The new national library in San Salvador, which President Nayib Bukele highlighted to secure his re-election, is one of Beijing's gifts to the country in exchange for its support. However, the facility places limited emphasis on reading.

title: Putin tells the West that Russia cannot be defeated in Ukraine
summary: In his two-hour message to the US and the West, the Russian president ruled out the idea of invading Poland or Latvia.

title: Swiss train hostage crisis ends with suspect killed and hostages freed
summary: Armed with an axe and a knife, the hostage-taker seized 15 hostages. He was ultimately shot dead by the police following a four-hour standoff.

title: European countries are turning to 'selective immigration' to mend labor shortages
summary: Under pressure from various business sectors, governments of all political leanings have amended legislation to make up for shortages in the labor force.

title: Supreme Court leans toward Trump's inclusion in Republican primaries
summary: The nine justices appear unconvinced by the legitimacy of the Colorado Supreme Court's December decision to exclude Donald Trump from the race for the Republican nomination in the state because of his role in the January 6, 2021 assault on the Capitol.

title: Trump wins Nevada Republican caucuses as sole participant
summary: Republican opponent Nikki Haley skipped the caucuses, which are the only contest in Nevada that counts toward the GOP nomination.

title: French government reshuffle: A long wait for a non-event
summary: A month on from his appointment as prime minister, Gabriel Attal revealed his new government. Among some familiar faces, the only big surprise was the appointment of Nicole Belloubet as education minister.

title: Vladimir Putin tells Tucker Carlson that Russia cannot be defeated in Ukraine
summary: In a publicity exercise conducted with the conservative American presenter, the Russian president also said he ruled out the idea of invading Poland or Latvia.

title: Olympic champion Semenya asks for financial help for legal fight
summary: South Africa’s two-time Olympic champion is preparing for her hearing at the European Court of Human Rights in May against regulations requiring female athletes with high testosterone to take medication.

title: Robert Badinter, who abolished the death penalty in France, has died
summary: The intangible, universal vision of human rights held by the former justice minister permeated his writings and opinions until the end of his life. He died in Paris on February 9, at 95 years of age.

title: The young French people who dream of becoming police officers
summary: Le Monde observed the oral exams for the police entrance examination. Young men and women, overwhelmingly from working-class backgrounds and in search of 'useful' jobs, had to explain their backgrounds and motivations.

title: Biden faces serious doubts about his health nine months before presidential election
summary: The 81-year-old US president's apparent physical frailty, combined with his occasionally confused comments, provides both an angle of attack for Republicans and a source of worry for over two-thirds of Americans.

title: Blessing same-sex couples confuses French Catholics
summary: The Vatican's December publication of the document 'Fiducia Supplicans,'  authorizing the blessing of same-sex couples, has aroused both hostility and incomprehension among some priests and faithful.

title: Reshuffle: Nicole Belloubet, the new Minister for Education and Youth, tackles a school in crisis
summary: The former justice minister replaces Amélie Oudéa-Castéra in a difficult context, with marked opposition from the teaching community to the reforms launched by Gabriel Attal.

title: Our die-hard obsession with virginity
summary: Le Monde columnist Maïa Mazaurette highlights the fixation on sexual innocence that persists in modern society.

title: Gazprombank executives quietly sold their French villas after the Ukraine invasion
summary: Since Russia's invasion of Ukraine in February 2022, properties linked to Russian bank boss Andrey Akimov, his family and associates have been sold. Some were held under dummy corporations and financed from tax havens.

title: Iran's Ayatollah Ali Khamenei removed from Instagram and Facebook
summary: Meta said the country's Supreme Leader's accounts were deleted for 'repeatedly violating our Dangerous Organizations and Individuals policy'.

title: Prince Harry settles phone hacking lawsuit against UK tabloid
summary: The Duke of Sussex settled his case against Mirror Group Newspapers, but said he will continue his legal battle against the publishers of the Daily Mail and The Sun.

title: French prosecutors seek trial for Lafarge cement group over terror financing
summary: The company paid nearly €13 million to middlemen to keep its Syrian cement factory running in 2013 and 2014, after other French firms had pulled out of the country.

title: Ukraine's Hungarian minority, caught between defending its identity and fear of Orban's policies
summary: The Hungarian prime minister criticizes Kyiv for not allowing the few thousand Hungarians in Ukraine to express themselves in their language. While few dare to speak out, most do not agree with this allegation which complicates their relationship with Ukraine.

title: In Egypt, Gazans are 'caught between war and a country that doesn't want' them
summary: A few hundred wounded people and their families who have been evacuated from the Gaza Strip are being cared for in Egyptian hospitals but are prevented from moving around the country, which opposes any influx of Gazans despite Israeli bombardment.

title: Two killed in Pakistan election protest as Khan allies lead in vote count
summary: Pakistan's former prime minister Nawaz Sharif said he would seek to form a coalition government after his party trailed independent candidates backed by his imprisoned rival, Imran Khan, in parliamentary election results.

title: Jacques Doillon, accused of rape by several actors including Judith Godrèche, denounces the 'lies'
summary: The French director characterized the allegations against him as 'arbitrary denunciations, false accusations and lies.'

title: Paris 2024: Thierry Henry faces the conundrum of assembling his Olympic football team roster
summary: With just six months to go before the Olympic Games, the France coach has little certainty over the identity of the players who will make up his squad, in which Antoine Griezmann and Kylian Mbappé are hoping to feature.
